Barnes and Noble carries it and you could either read the article there at

Some articles from HEM are put online each month. The coming-up issue isn't
there yet.
If Mary's isn't one of them, and if she wants to, I'll put in on a page and
link it to my website. She let me do that with something she wrote on video
games. That is here:

http://sandradodd.com/games/nintendogold

Sandra

messages.messageBody:
Have you checked to see if your library has a subscription?
That's how I read it, since I don't get HEM at the moment, either.
If the library doesn't have it, maybe a large bookstore like Borders or
Barnes and Noble carries it and you could either read the article there at
the bookstore or just buy a copy.

Karin

messages.subject: Re: zenmomma's article in HEM
messages.msgSnippet: ... into them?   I see you live near there.  My cousin is Eric Bergoust, the freestyle ski-jumper, he lives out there too.  I wanted to go so bad, but didn t
messages.messageBody:
>> Did you guys get to the winter Olympics at all? Did your son get
into them? I see you live near there. My cousin is Eric Bergoust,
the freestyle ski-jumper, he lives out there too. I wanted to go so
bad, but didn't work out.>>

Confession time. We left town for the Olympics! I feel bad when I
hear how badly others wanted to go. We were pretty spooked by the
9/11 thing and intimidated by the huge crowds that were invading our
small town. We decided to lay low in the Florida sunshine instead. :o)

I saw your cousin in a photo shoot right across the street from me.
My neighbor is Fuzz...(can't think of his last name right now) and he
too was an Olympian. He now works for the team and was running the
shoot that day. It was very cool to watch. Many of those cool aerial
shots of skiers and snowboarders taken against the blue sky are
actually taken during the summer on a trampoline! We learned lots
that day.

Life is good.
~Mary

P.S. Glad you liked my article.

messages.subject: Re: zenmomma's article in HEM
messages.msgSnippet: ... best friend has just recognized her little boy in The Out of Sync Child, so I ll be passing it on to her.  BTW, your book title seems just perfect :0).
messages.messageBody:
>> Mary - I just got this month's HEM, and enjoyed your article. My
best friend has just recognized her little boy in The Out of Sync
Child, so I'll be passing it on to her. BTW, your book title seems
just perfect :0). ~Rue>>

Thanks, Rue. I've turned off my list mail for awhile so I can get a
better handle on everything else in the whole wide world. ;-) Karin
mentioned to me that you commented on my article so I'm popping in to
say hi. I'm glad you liked it and I hope your friend sees the light
as far as unschooling her child.

>>BTW, your book title seems just perfect :0).>>

Kind of an obvious choice, huh? LOL

Life is good.
~Mary

messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] zenmomma's article in HEM
messages.msgSnippet: Yes, Mary,  I also read your article,  very nice,  I will be checking out the book you spoke of it, sounds alot like my son. Did you guys get to the winter
messages.messageBody:
Yes, Mary, I also read your article, very nice, I will be checking out the book you spoke of it, sounds alot like my son.

Did you guys get to the winter Olympics at all? Did your son get into them? I see you live near there. My cousin is Eric Bergoust, the freestyle ski-jumper, he lives out there too. I wanted to go so bad, but didn't work out.
Take Care,
Kelli
Jon and Rue Kream <skreams@...> wrote:Mary - I just got this month's HEM, and enjoyed your article. My best
friend has just recognized her little boy in The Out of Sync Child, so I'll
be passing it on to her. BTW, your book title seems just perfect :0). ~Rue

messages.messageBody:
Mary - I just got this month's HEM, and enjoyed your article. My best
friend has just recognized her little boy in The Out of Sync Child, so I'll
be passing it on to her. BTW, your book title seems just perfect :0). ~Rue
